definition: likely to be affected by something, something (a person or object or scene) selected by an artist or photographer for graphic representation, refer for judgment or consideration
details:
adjective
- likely to be affected by something
= example: likely to be affected by something
- being under the power or sovereignty of another or others
= example: being under the power or sovereignty of another or others
= synonyms: dependent
- possibly accepting or permitting
= synonyms: open
noun
- something (a person or object or scene) selected by an artist or photographer for graphic representation
= example: something (a person or object or scene) selected by an artist or photographer for graphic representation
= synonyms: content, depicted object
- some situation or event that is thought about
= synonyms: matter
- a branch of knowledge
= synonyms: study
- one of the two main constituents of a sentence
= example: one of the two main constituents of a sentence
= synonyms: predicate
- (logic) the first term of a proposition
- the subject matter of a conversation or discussion
= example: the subject matter of a conversation or discussion
= synonyms: topic, theme
- a person who owes allegiance to that nation
= example: a person who owes allegiance to that nation
= synonyms: national
- a person who is subjected to experimental or other observational procedures
= synonyms: case
verb
- refer for judgment or consideration
= synonyms: submit
- make accountable for
= example: make accountable for
- cause to experience or suffer or make liable or vulnerable to
= example: cause to experience or suffer or make liable or vulnerable to
- make subservient
= synonyms: subjugate
